intro: Comesperma roseum, commonly known as the pink comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats. The flowers are pollinated by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance in native ecosystems.
